newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Swiss say may extradite Turk businessmen to India.
newsitem.headline: Swiss say may extradite Turk businessmen to India.

text.p: Switzerland has agreed to an Indian government request to extradite two jailed Turkish businessmen accused of economic offences and financial wrongdoing, the Swiss federal police said on Friday.
Spokesman Falco Galli declined to reveal details of the Indian charges against the two, top managers of a Turkish company, Karsan Limited.

But Indian media reports have alleged the two are accused of wrongdoing in a deal involving a $38 million state purchase of fertilisers.The two, who were arrested in Switzerland in September, have a month to appeal against the decision.
The Swiss government froze the Geneva bank accounts of the businessmen after India asked Switzerland to block their assets in October, Galli said. He gave no details of the amounts blocked.
"We have treated the question of extradition of persons and extradition of funds separately. There is still a decision to be made about the repatriation of funds," he said.
